messages.message: Unexpected any. Specify a different type.

suggestions.desc: Use `unknown` instead, this will force you to explicitly, and safely assert the type is correct.
Use `never` instead, this is useful when instantiating generic type parameters that you don't need to know the type of.

messages.message: Async pipe results should not be negated. Use `(observable | async) === false`, `(observable | async) === null`, or `(observable | async) === undefined` to check its value instead

suggestions.desc: Compare with `false`
Compare with `null`
Compare with `undefined`

source:
{{ "checkoutReview.review" | cxTranslate }}

{{ "cartItems.cartTotal" | cxTranslate : { count: cart.deliveryItemsQuantity } }}: {{ cart.totalPrice?.formattedValue }}
{{ "checkoutReview.placeOrder" | cxTranslate }}

messages.message:
Don't use `{}` as a type. `{}` actually means "any non-nullish value".
- If you want a type meaning "any object", you probably want `object` instead.
- If you want a type meaning "any value", you probably want `unknown` instead.
- If you want a type meaning "empty object", you probably want `Record<string, never>` instead.
Unexpected any. Specify a different type.

suggestions.desc: Use `unknown` instead, this will force you to explicitly, and safely assert the type is correct.
Use `never` instead, this is useful when instantiating generic type parameters that you don't need to know the type of.

messages.message: Async pipe results should not be negated. Use `(observable | async) === false`, `(observable | async) === null`, or `(observable | async) === undefined` to check its value instead

Use `never` instead, this is useful when instantiating generic type parameters that you don't need to know the type of.

suggestions.desc: Compare with `false`
Compare with `null`
Compare with `undefined`
